snippet: The United States military will continue indefinitely to operate a section of the Parwan complex holding foreign combatants, even as the two countries mark a transfer of authority.
abstract: United States military will indefinitely maintain control over dozens of foreign detainees in the Parwan complex at Bagram Air Base in Afghanistan, even as the two countries prepare to ceremonially mark the hand-over of detention operations to the Afghan government; although thousands of Afghan detainees have already been turned over, the US will continue to hold and screen newly captured Afghans for a time.

byline.original: By CHARLIE SAVAGE and GRAHAM BOWLEY
byline.contributor: Charlie Savage reported from Washington, and Graham Bowley from Bagram, Afghanistan.

lead_paragraph: The United States military will continue indefinitely to operate a section of the Parwan complex holding foreign combatants, even as the two countries mark a transfer of authority.

headline.seo: U.S. Will Hold Part of Afghan Prison After Handover
headline.main: U.S. to Retain Role as a Jailer in Afghanistan
headline.print_headline: U.S. to Retain Role as a Jailer In Afghanistan

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
